text: Gorgeous elegy of old New York.
author: ByJessicaGould

text: Ahem
author: ByJessicaGould

text: Liu says the meetings will go beyond SHSAT to discuss diversity and admissions more broadly.
author: ByJessicaGould

text: Community meetings coming to address SHSAT: “We want to facilitate and legislate,” says NYS Senator John Liu. BUT Liu also says @NYCMayor plan to eliminate test has gone nowhere because “it’s deeply flawed.”
author: ByJessicaGould

text: It’s not just the specialized schools, it’s the system: Op-Ed: NYC High School Admissions Creates Winners And Losers. I Lost.: Gothamist
author: ByJessicaGould

text: CBO teachers make $15,000 to $30,000 less than DOE counterparts, organizers say. As Mayor de Blasio touts UPK in Iowa and New Hampshire, the union representing many of these teachers is threatening to strike.
author: ByJessicaGould

text: A lesser known fact about universal pre-k in NYC. Teachers employed by the city DOE make more than those working at community based organizations under the same UPK umbrella.
author: ByJessicaGould

text: Oops! Thanks for the important clarification. It would take 9 years to visit every school if the chancellor visited one every day.  Not 90.  Still stunning.
author: ByJessicaGould

text: Interesting question from edu comm chair @MarkTreyger718: "Who pays for the SHSAT? "We do, by state law," @DOEChancellor says. Treyger asks whether the city can exert more control over the content of the test. (But don't all standardized tests generate race and gender gaps?)
author: ByJessicaGould

text: "There is a perception that you have to go to certain elementary schools, and if you don't forget it." Same with middle schools and high schools. "Consider for a minute that there's more than a portfolio of four or five schools with incredible opportunities." @DOEChancellor says.
author: ByJessicaGould

text: And furthermore, @DOEChancellor says: Gifted and Talented program is not effective as it currently exists.
author: ByJessicaGould

text: On school segregation: "What is the administration going to do...?" asks Councilmember Chin. @DOEChancellor: calls specialized schools numbers "abhorrent." He says the SHSAT should NOT be single criteria for admission. "There is a structural issue."
author: ByJessicaGould

text: "There are no sacred cows," @DOEChancellor says of whether there might be individual school budget cuts. But he says they would be among the last to get hit.
author: ByJessicaGould

text: And speaking of student empowerment...
author: ByJessicaGould

text: Schools chancellor Richard Carranza at budget hearing says he's proudest of shifting to a stronger focus on student and parent empowerment. Students and parents: thoughts on this?
author: ByJessicaGould

text: NYC DOE budget hearing at city council today. Topics under discussion: support for homeless students, pay parity for pre-k teachers, state funding shortfall...
author: ByJessicaGould

text: Tune in!
author: ByJessicaGould

text: I’ve heard from black Stuy alums who want their voices heard more re: the news on admissions. @beenishfahmed captured some of them, months ago.
author: ByJessicaGould

text: And the worst part is they’re my toddler’s chicken nuggets!
author: ByJessicaGould

text: Chicken nuggets and a beer.
author: ByJessicaGould

text: It's Match Day for eighth graders at NYC Public Schools! City says 45% of students got their first choice, and over 70% got one of their top three.
author: ByJessicaGould
